Setelah Kadis Pariwisata, Kepala Bappeda Izin Mundur ke Anies
01 Nov 2019, 16:22 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Gubernur Anies Baswedan. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/ Adhi Wicaksono)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Kepala Bappeda DKI Jakarta Sri Mahendra menyatakan mengundurkan diri dari jabatannya. Dia mengatakan lembaga tersebut membutuhkan kinerja yang lebih baik lagi."Saya mengajukan permohonan untuk mengundurkan diri dengan harapan akselerasi Bappeda dapat lebih ditingkatkan," kata dia.Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan menuturkan apresiasi terhadap Sri Mahendra walaupun terkejut. Pengganti Sri Mahendra adalah Deputi Gubernur DKI Bidang Pengendalian Penduduk dan Permukiman,  Suharti.Sri Mahendra adalah orang kedua yang mengundurkan diri setelah Kadis Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan DKI Jakarta Edy Junaedi. Sebelumnya, Kepala Dinas Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan DKI Jakarta Edy Junaedi dikabarkan mengundurkan diri dari jabatannya. Sekretaris Dinas Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan Asiantoro mengatakan telah mendapat info tersebut dari yang bersangkutan."Tadi, beliau ngomong begitu [mengundurkan diri] sama saya," kata Asiantoro saat dihubungi, Jumat (1/11).Namun Asiantoro menolak berbicara lebih lanjut terkait pengunduran diri Edy. Asiantoro juga mengaku tidak tahu menahu alasan Edy mundur dari jabatannya.Pengunduran diri keduanya tak lama setelah kabar tentang masalah yang muncul pada Kebijakan Umum APBD Plafon Prioritas Anggaran Sementara (KUAPPAS) DKI 2020. Di antaranya soal rencana anggaran lem aibon senilai Rp82 miliar. Sementara terkait dengan pariwisata, dinas tersebut juga diketahui menganggarkan Rp5 miliar untuk lima influencer asing guna mempromosikan pariwisata Jakarta. Namun, akhirnya anggaran itu dibatalkan.(ctr/asa)

After the Head of Tourism Office, Head of Bappeda Permits to Resign to Anies
01 Nov 2019, 16:22 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Governor Anies Baswedan. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Adhi Wicaksono)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Head of DKI Jakarta Bappeda Sri Mahendra said that he resigned from his post. He said the agency needed better performance. "I submit a request to resign in the hope that the acceleration of Bappeda can be further improved," he said. Substitute Sri Mahendra is DKI's Deputy Governor for Population and Settlement Control, Suharti. Sri Mahendra is the second person to resign after the Head of DKI Jakarta Tourism and Culture Edy Junaedi. Previously, Head of DKI Jakarta Tourism and Culture Office Edy Junaedi reportedly resigned from his position. The Secretary of the Office of Tourism and Culture of Asiantoro said that he had received this information from the relevant person. "Earlier, he said so [resigned] with me," Asiantoro said when contacted on Friday (1/11). But Asiantoro refused to talk further related to resignation. Edy Asiantoro also claimed not to know the reason why Edy stepped down from his position. The resignation of the two was not long after news of a problem that appeared in the General Policy of the 2020 2020 Provisional Budget Ceiling (KUAPPAS) in DKI. While related to tourism, the agency is also known to have budgeted Rp5 billion for five foreign influencers to promote Jakarta tourism. However, finally the budget was canceled. (Ctr / asa)
